result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert A Skenandore Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Stalking - Result in Bodily Harm [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.32(2).
  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Surcharge], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Surcharge], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Surcharge], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Denying Request for Expungement, signed and filed.  Copy mailed to defendant.  rmm
Per order of Presiding Judge, Misdemeanor Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Rebecca A. Kiefer, Br. 29, calendar successor, for review. mag

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Robert A Skenandore in court with attorney Angele R. Dentice.  Defendant Robert A Skenandore in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
Parties are in court for sentencing.
As to count 2:
  Sentencing proceeds.    Upon inquiry of the Court, State advises they have complied with victim notification. Statements by counsel and defendant.   

COURT ORDERS defendant to serve 9 months at the House of Correction with 270 days credit.  Time served disposition.
Defendant to pay all applicable costs, assessments and surcharges, including the DV and DNA surcharges from bail on deposit.  If there is no posted bail the defendant is to pay the costs and surcharges during the defendant's probation period,  failure to pay the costs and surcharges will result in a civil judgment.
Court advises the defendant he may not possess a firearm; is to provide a DNA sample.
Appeal rights given.  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief, Pretrial Incarceration Credit.

As to counts 6 and 7:
 
COURT ORDERS defendant to serve 3 months at the House of Correction as to each count, concurrent with each other but consecutive to count 2, with 23 days credit.
Defendant to pay all applicable costs, assessments and surcharges, including the DV and DNA surcharges from bail on deposit.  If there is no posted bail the defendant is to pay the costs and surcharges while defendant is on probation, failure to pay the costs and surcharges will result in a civil judgment.
Court advises the defendant he may not possess a firearm; is to provide a DNA sample.  
Appeal rights given.  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief, Pretrial Incarceration Credit.

As to count 1:
  
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 4 years, with credit for -0- DAYS time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 2 years; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 years. 
The Court STAYED this sentence and placed the defendant on probation for a period of 4 YEARS, concurrent,  with the following conditions:
* Defendant to be monitored by the Mental Health Unit.
*   Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling.
*   Obtain an AODA assessment and follow-up treatment;
*   Maintain absolute sobriety with random urine screens - no illegal drugs; 
*   No contact with victim.  No other modification without the approval of the court.  
*   Defendant to have a mental health evaluation and cooperate with any treatment.
*   Pay supervision fees;
*   Provide a DNA sample - pay surcharge;
*   Pay all remaining costs, surcharges and assessments, including the DV surcharge,  bail to apply, if any, remaining costs and surcharges are to be paid during the period of probation or a civil judgment will be issued.
.
The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Earned Release Program.
The Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he/she may not vote until his/her civil rights are restored and he/she may never possess a firearm.
Filed Pretrial Incarceration Credit;
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.

Defendant Robert A Skenandore in court with attorney Angele R. Dentice.  Defendant Robert A Skenandore in custody.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
Defense counsel informed the court that she will be asking for an adjournment for sentencing.
On state's motion the criminal complaint was amended to reflect the year "2015" not "2014".
As to counts 1, 2, 6 and 7:
  Defendant waived  rights and pled guilty.
Guilty Plea Questionnaire, Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights and Elements of Criminal Offenses - Felonies received and filed.
Defendant examined as to his plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information.  Judgment of Conviction entered.
As to counts 3, 4, 5, 8 and 9:
On motion of the state and pursuant to negotiations, court ordered counts 3, 4, 5, 8 and 9 dismissed and read-in for sentencing.
.
Case adjourned for a sentencing hearing in Branch 36.
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 10, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Robert A Skenandore in court with attorney Angele R. Dentice.  Defendant Robert A Skenandore in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin for Sarra Kiaie.  
cab
Defense counsel waived reading of the Complaint and entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of defendant.
Case adjourned for a plea and sentencing hearing in branch 36.

  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 20, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Robert A Skenandore in court with attorney Angele R. Dentice.  Defendant Robert A Skenandore in custody.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.
The parties are requesting an adjournment for the arraignment.
  Arraignment scheduled for September 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant not allowed to leave Milwaukee County.  Defendant is to comply with any medications he is prescribed.  Complete sobriety; random screens.  Defendant to have no contact with victim.  No contact order received and filed.

Defendant Robert A Skenandore in court with attorney Angele R. Dentice.  Defendant Robert A Skenandore in custody.  Sarra Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
    Doctor's report received and filed.  Parties reviewed report and do not contest findings.  Court found defendant competent to proceed and reinstated proceedings.  Arguments heard as to bail.
Court ordered bail set at:  $5,000.00 cash.  Defendant not allowed to leave Milwaukee County.  Defendant is to comply with any medications he is prescribed.  Complete sobriety; random screens.  Defendant to have no contact with victim.  No contact order received and filed.
Case adjourned for a preliminary hearing in Branch 36.

  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Robert A Skenandore in court with attorney Angele R. Dentice.  Defendant Robert A Skenandore in custody.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for Competency Hearing. Defense advised the court that Dr. Kenneth Sherry has not complied with the Order for Psychological Evaluation and Competency Evaluation signed by the court on 7/1/2015. Defense counsel requested an adjournment. State made objections as to further delay of the Competency Hearing on the record. DIscussion regarding proceeding forward with the competency hearing. State advised the court that Dr. Rawski has concerns regarding the amount of time that has passed since the initial evaluation and the competency evaluation previously submitted by the Wisconsin Forensic Unit to the court. Discussion regarding re-evaluation by Dr. Rawski. Court adjourned matter for a competency hearing. Court signed and filed, Order for Competency Evaluation for Dr. Rawski. Court signed, and filed, Order for Psychological Evaluation and Competency Evaluation for Dr. Kenneth Sherry, to be completed by 8/19/2015. Case set for Competency Hearing in branch 26.   Parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Jeffrey Kremers, Branch 36 in Courthouse room 502.  Competency hearing scheduled for September 8, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Signed & Filed, Order for Psychological Evaluation and Competency Evaluation. Dr. Kenneth Sherry. Evaluation to be returned to Court no later than July 24, 2015.
Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.

Defendant Robert A Skenandore in court with attorney Angele R. Dentice.  Defendant Robert A Skenandore in custody.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for a Competency Evaluation. Case called at 1:30 PM due to defense counsel scheduling conflict. Defense unable to proceed with competency evaluation, unable obtain a secondary competency evaluation from Dr. Emily or Dr. Sherri for reasons stated on the record. Defense counsel requests an adjournment of the competency hearing to allow an additional evaluation to be completed by Dr. Brian Bradley. Defendant did not object. State objected for reasons stated on the record. Court GRANTED the adjournment. Signed & Filed in case 14CM4177, Copies returned to defense counsel, Order For Psychological Evaluation and Competency Evaluation. Court ordered that the evaluation take place no latter than 7/15/2015 and a copy of the report be tendered to the court no later than 7/24/2014. Court set matter for Return on Doctor's Report and Competency Evaluation in branch 23.   Parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Jeffrey Kremers, Branch 36 in Courthouse room 502. Court tolled the time limits for substitution based on case proceedings being suspended. Defendant reminded to abided by the no contact order. Case adjourned to branch 23.  Competency hearing scheduled for July 27, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Robert A Skenandore in court with attorney Angele R. Dentice.  Defendant Robert A Skenandore in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay for Sarra Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for Return of Doctor's Report.  Court reviewed Wisconsin Forensic Unit Report. Report states that Dr. Pankiewicz found that the defendant is competent to proceed. Defense counsel contested the findings, requests additional evaluation by Dr. Stephen Emily or Kenneth Sherri. Court ordered evaluation, and ordered Attorney Dentice to present the court with an order for either Dr. Emily or Sherri after consultation with the doctor's. Case set for a contested competency hearing. State to subpoena Dr. Pankiewicz for hearing. Case adjourned to branch 23.  Competency hearing scheduled for June 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Received & Filed, Wisconsin Forensic Unit Report.

Defendant Robert A Skenandore in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Defendant Robert A Skenandore in custody.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Court is advised by the defense there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed.  Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court found probable cause and ordered defendant examined by the Forensic Unit.  Order for Examination, signed and filed.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge GRADY, Branch 23.   Court ordered defendant REMANDED into custody of Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  COURTS TOLL THE TIME LIMITS FOR THE PRELIMINARY HEARING.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for April 2, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
